info.description:
# Workflow on how to export projects
## Get a list of public projects by calling /Projects.
## For each project
### Open a project delta session and get the project info by calling /openProjectDeltaSession(projectId, timestampPreviousCall, exportedEntities)

   * _projectId_ is the project ID property,
   * _timestampPreviousCall_ is:
        * null to get the full project,
        * nextTimestamp returned by the last call to openProjectDeltaSession for this project to have the project delta from this last call.
   * _exportedEntities_ is an optional array of ProjectDeltaSessionEntityType that can be used to define the type of objects returned by openProjectDeltaSession, or that can be retrieved from openProjectDeltaSession ("projectMember", "subProjectMember", "package", "investmentVersion", "packageInvestmentVersionedAmount", "subProjectInvestmentVersionedAmount", "items", "itemVersionedAmount", "deletedItems", "subProjectScheduleMilestone", "scheduleElement").
   
  _openProjectDeltaSession_ will return the project, its members, its public subprojects and their members, packages, investment versions, product structure assignments (BOM header assignments), subproject milestones as well as the subproject's total investment versioned amounts depending on the value of _exportedEntities_.
  It also returns a _sessionId_, _updatedItemPageCount_, _deletedItemIdsPageCount_, _updatedPackageInvestmentVersionedAmountPageCount_ and _updatedItemInvestmentVersionedAmountPageCount_ that must be used in the following delta functions.
 ### Get all the items with their schedule elements or only the updated items (if a timestamp was provided in _openProjectDeltaSession_) by calling either:
   * /getDeltaSubProjectItems(sessionId, pageNumber) with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_ and pageNumber = 0 to _updatedItemPageCount_ -1 (also returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_).
   * /ReportingProjectSessions(sessionId)/items with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_. You can paginate the result here, select the properties you want to get, or filter the result, as it is a call to an OData entity.
 ### Get nothing (if no timestamp was provided) or the IDs of completely deleted items since the timestamp provided to _openProjectDeltaSession_ by calling either:
   * /getDeltaDeletedItems(sessionId, pageNumber) with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_ and pageNumber = 0 to _deletedItemIdsPageCount_ -1.
   * /ReportingProjectSessions(sessionId)/deletedItems with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.
 ### Get all the package versioned amounts or only the new ones (if a timestamp was provided to _openProjectDeltaSession_) by calling either:
   * /getDeltaPackageVersionedAmounts(sessionId, pageNumber) with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_ and pageNumber = 0 to _updatedPackageInvestmentVersionedAmountPageCount_ -1.
   * /ReportingProjectSessions(sessionId)/packageVersionedAmounts  with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.
 ### Get all the item versioned amounts or only the new ones (if a timestamp was provided to _openProjectDeltaSession_) by calling either:
   * /getDeltaItemVersionedAmounts(sessionId, pageNumber) with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_ and pageNumber = 0 to _updatedItemInvestmentVersionedAmountPageCount_ -1.
   * /ReportingProjectSessions(sessionId)/itemVersionedAmounts with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.
 ### Close the project delta session by calling /closeProjectDeltaSession(sessionId) with _sessionId_ being the _sessionId_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.
## Get all the business configuration entities and the predefined content entities (by usual OData calls).
### nextTimestamp
  _openProjectDeltaSession_ returns _nextTimestamp_ that can be used the next time it will be called for the same project to get the delta changes from this date. Please note that the _nextTimestamp_ returned is not the exact time when _openProjectDeltaSession_ is called but 10 minutes before, as other transactions may have changes that are not yet committed with updates done before the time the _openProjectDeltaSession_ is called.
### Deleted Items
  After a BOM update in a subproject, some items may be taken out of the subproject. They will have the productStructureStatus_code = 'Deleted'. In the **Export Procurement Projects API**, these items will have isDeleted = true in _getDeltaSubProjectItems_. Items with isDeleted = true should no longer be used in aggregations of the current amounts in the subproject and packages. When these items are resolved by the user in the subproject, they will be deleted permanently. In the **Export Procurement Projects API**, their IDs will be retuned by _getDeltaDeletedItems_ and they will no longer appear in the result of _getDeltaSubProjectItems_.
### Investment Version Deletion
  When an investment version of a subproject is deleted, it no longer appears in the investment versions of the subproject in the output of _openProjectDeltaSession_. If you had this version in a previous call, you can delete it and also delete the item investment versioned amounts and package investment versioned amounts of this deleted version.
# Limitations
- You cannot send more than 1000 requests per hour or more than 10000 requests within 24 hours.
- You cannot have more than 50 sessions open in parallel.
- You cannot have more than 10 sessions open in parallel within 1 minute.
- You cannot open more than 1000 sessions within 24 hours.

If this occurs, a HTTP 429 error will be returned.

After 2 hours, an open session will be closed automatically.
info.title: Procurement Project Export

x-sap-shortText: This asynchronous service enables you to export public projects and their subprojects.

externalDocs.description: More information is available at the SAP S/4HANA for procurement planning SAP Help Portal page.

get.summary: Retrieves specific COP Capacities using their codes.
get.description: The code of the requested COP Capacity is required as parameter. Additionally, the standard OData parameters are supported. As response, exactly one COP Capacity is returned. If no COP Capacity is found in the system with the requested ID, the endpoint returns an appropriate error message.

post.summary: Invokes the action to open a session on a public project to be able to retrieve delta information on it.
post.description:
Opens a session on a public project to be able to retrieve delta information on it. As long as the session is open, the other functions _getDeltaSubProjectItems_, _getDeltaDeletedItems_, _getDeltaPackageVersionedAmounts_ and _getDeltaItemVersionedAmounts_ can be used to get delta information on the project. Use _closeProjectDeltaSession_ to close the project delta session.

A session will be closed automatically after 2 hours.

If more than 50 sessions are open, if there are more than 10 sessions opened in parallel within 1 minute or if more than 1000 sessions are opened within 24 hours, a HTTP 429 error will be returned when opening a new session.

get.summary: Retrieves IDs of items that have been deleted since the last project delta session.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The _sessionID_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: 0 to deletedItemIdsPageCount - 1. It will return nothing if the project delta session has been opened without a timestamp

get.summary: Retrieves item investment versioned amounts that have changed for a project delta session.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The _sessionID_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: 0 to updatedItemInvestmentVersionedAmountPageCount - 1.

get.summary: Retrieves the packages totals for investment versioned amounts that have changed for a project delta session.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The _sessionID_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: 0 to updatedPackageInvestmentVersionedAmountPageCount - 1.

get.summary: Retrieves items that have changed and their schedule for a project delta session.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The _sessionID_ returned by _openProjectDeltaSession_.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: 0 to updatedItemPageCount - 1.

post.summary: Invokes the action to close a project delta session.
post.description: Closes a session on a public project. As soon as the session is closed, the other functions _getDeltaSubProjectItems_, _getDeltaDeletedItems_, _getDeltaPackageVersionedAmounts_ and _getDeltaItemVersionedAmounts_ cannot be used anymore.

error400.description: Bad Request: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g. malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

error401.description: Unauthorized: The user does not have valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

error403.description: Forbidden: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action. This may be due to the user not having the necessary permissions for a resource or needing an account of some sort, or attempting a prohibited action (e.g. creating a duplicate record where only one is allowed).

error404.description: Not Found: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

error405.description: Method Not Allowed: A request method is not supported for the requested resource; for example, a GET request on a form that requires data to be presented via POST, or a PUT request on a read-only resource.

error406.description: Not Acceptable: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.

error429.description: Too Many Requests: Too many requests were sent in a given amount of time.
